document_data.mainbody:
'''Thrusk''' was a hardy wild grass often used for making [[infusion]]s.
{{quote|''Thrusk in the morning wakes a man, banishes sour breath, and kindles hero-fire within. It also leaves the drinker unable to taste anything else, sleepless, and swift to rageâ€”and draws beasts near. Yet if a slinking monster disturbs a dedicated thrusk-drinker, it's often difficult from the snarls to tell one from the other.''|[[Imgaun Cordelvur]]. ''[[We Can All Dine like Kings]]'', {{yearlinkName|1329}}{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|135-140|9}}}}
document_data.Description: Thrusk grew in tufts. It had roots that ran deep, making it very hardy and resistant to droughts and heatwaves.
document_data.History: Thrusk was drunk in [[Orthil Voldovan]]'s caravan during its passage from [[Scornubel]] to [[Waterdeep]] late in the {{yearlinkName|1357}}.
